meanings.definition: Showing an arrogant or conceited attitude.
meanings.sent1: He became even cockier after winning the game.
meanings.sent2: She felt cockier than usual after receiving praise for her work.
meanings.sent3: His cockier attitude made him think he was the best player on the team.
meanings.sent4: The cockier cat strutted around the house as if she owned it.
meanings.sent5: The cockier student always thought he knew more than the teacher.

meanings.definition: To boast or brag in a self-important manner.
meanings.sent1: He would cockier about his accomplishments to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: She tends to cockier whenever she achieves something noteworthy.
meanings.sent3: The little boy would cockier about his toy collection to impress his friends.
meanings.sent4: She would cockier about her cooking skills, but her burnt dinner told a different story.
meanings.sent5: The politician loved to cockier about his plans for the future during his speeches.
